intro: Buglossum angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved bugloss, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It blooms from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
